Comment: The order A-N occurs in lexicalized Sino-Vietnamese compouds. The preposed elements behave like bound morphoemes, and do not take complements (Trang Phan).
When an adjective modifies a noun in a noun phrase, it follows the noun.
This word order is only grammatical as a clause-level fronting, but ungrammatical as nominal modifier.
Vietnamese has a SVO word order.
